bug.short_desc: Move EPUB support into weekly/release builds

long_desc.thetext:
The EPUB support now appears to be stable. Recent bug fixes have mostly been enhancements and no vital issues have been found. Hence it should be moved into weekly builds and released with Mylyn Docs 1.7.The following tasks remain:
* Make sure the manifest and bundle information is correct. * Prepare release notes and UI review (demo). * Add projects to SDK feature bug 376298.

I'm in the process of updating copyrights and bundle metadata - while at it I would like to also change the version number of the EPUB tools to indicate the change of status. Unless there are any objections I'll set this to 1.0.0.
Copyrights are for the most part "2011, 2012 Torkild U. Resheim" and bundle vendor is set to "Eclipse Mylyn". The license and branding is the same as in o.e.m.wikitext-feature.
Current "new and noteworthy" regarding the EPUB support is sufficient. While there are some improvements, only early adopters will notice the difference.

Videos demonstrating the main features; the Wizard and the Ant task is available at YouTube. They are a a little old, but there are no major changes. The only big differences are validation in the wizard and more log output from the Ant task: * http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0uZv7e4mYc (Ant task) * http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kdcDMmx2ohY&feature=relmfu (Wizard)
The EPUB reader show is a very early version of Elibrarium (http://turesheim.github.com/elibrarium/).

Thanks a lot for the awesome videos! Can we link/embed them on the New & Noteworthy?
I have updated the site.xml and build files and kicked off a new build that should include EPUB: https://hudson.eclipse.org/hudson/job/mylyn-3.8.x-release/14/console .

(In reply to comment #4) > Thanks a lot for the awesome videos! Can we link/embed them on the New & > Noteworthy? Thanks for verifying. I'll kick off a build shortly to consume the recent changes.
Looks like we are done here.

Thanks Steffen,

Closing as the fix is in a released version.
